intro: Otanthera bracteata, commonly known as the golden ragwort, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, sunny areas such as meadows and stream banks. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, bract-like structures that surround its flower heads. Otanthera bracteata is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
